summary: This bill, the Securing Academia from Foreign Entanglements Act, amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to prohibit institutions of higher education from receiving gifts or entering contracts with 'foreign countries of concern.' These countries are defined as those covered under specific national security regulations or those deemed detrimental to U.S. national security or foreign policy by a panel of federal officials. The bill carves out exceptions, particularly concerning student costs such as tuition.
